Row.Text: Mature Persona
Likes civilizations that form alliances. Dislikes civilizations that lack allies.

Chisato Shirasagi, the adept and composed anchor—though far more than just "composed". Look back with amusement at your once thunderous lecturing sessions, and cast aside a past tangled with hesitation plus concerns over appearances—elegance and consideration are dignified talismans, capable of nurturing depth and aiding transformation through trials of assistance. Thus, the master attains the Way, and a cultured heart transforms others.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Culture] Culture from adjacent Luxury resources.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Culture] Culture from adjacent Bonus resources.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Culture] Culture from adjacent Entertainment Complexes.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Culture] Culture from adjacent Water Parks.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Culture] Culture from adjacent Idol Theaters.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Culture] Culture from adjacent Child Star Guilds.
+{1_iBonus} {2_YieldIcon} Culture from {3_AdjacentSubjectNum} Diplomatic policy cards.
+{1_iBonus} {2_YieldIcon} Gold from {3_AdjacentSubjectNum} Diplomatic policy cards.
Is there a need for a proper lecturing?
The bassist of Pastel*Palettes, active as a child star since childhood. Due to her child star experience, she is very good at controlling situations and maintaining her personal image.
Enjoys drinking tea in cafes and shopping. Likes light-flavored foods, açaí bowls; her drink of choice is black tea. Dislikes natto and also dislikes spicy food.

Has a smile that looks kind but is unfathomable. Behind that iron-wall smile, Chisato is a typical scheming queen, not only knowing how to use others but also suddenly turning dark when encountering unpleasant situations, revealing her famous "look of contempt"[NEWLINE]-"Is there a need for a proper lecturing?"

Her drawing skills are... touching (picture of Little Jennifer.jpg). Afraid of insects, and confused by train routes. Has subtly wonderful relationships with Aya, Kanon, Kaoru, and others (ah, we sentimental audience).
(Compiled from Fandom and Moegirlpedia)

Guilds/unions are organizations established by practitioners of the same trade to protect common interests. The entertainment industry is no exception; countries like the US and UK had actors' unions as early as the beginning of the twentieth century.

As is well known, Chisato Shirasagi debuted as a child star early on and is possibly the most famous child star in BanG Dream!. Therefore, it is not unreasonable for her to spearhead a guild that brings together child stars and former child stars.
Wow, isn't this Miss Chisato Shirasagi?! I never thought I'd have the honor of meeting the big star from TV!!!
You are Chisato Shirasagi.
I think it's really great to have everyone here. If alone, perhaps one couldn't overcome obstacles.
What you've done so far, how is it any different from a trainee who thinks their efforts have paid off?
She likes civilizations that form alliances.
She dislikes civilizations that lack alliances.
Does the private me seem novel to you? Hehe, thank you.
Idols must follow the rules...
It's good to have partners you can communicate with sincerely. I want to become a genuine partner; I want to communicate properly with you.
Does the private me seem novel to you? Hehe, thank you.
Idols must follow the rules...
I merely choose the path where I won't fail...
I merely choose the path where I won't fail...
There is no future left... not even my name... How can I recover it...? How can I seize the chance to recover...?
There is no future left... not even my name... How can I recover it...? How can I seize the chance to recover...?
Although it's a bit embarrassing to say directly... thank you again for your encouragement. From now on, please continue to treat me well!
I apologize, I am unable to attend. If you don't mind, please feel welcome to come again!
Our delegation has brought an exquisite afternoon tea from Hanezawa Cafe. I made a deal with Tsugumi; if you are satisfied, she will open a branch here, hehe.
Ah, that's rather impolite of you.
Ah, that's rather impolite of you.
Hello, I am Chisato Shirasagi, the bassist of Pastel*Palettes. Thank you for your patronage. I hope the next time we meet will be on our stage...
Speaking of PasPale, it is indeed the power of five that allows us to stick together firmly. Citizens of your nation are also welcome to enjoy our performances!
Eh? What am I doing here?... Nothing in particular, just taking a walk.
Thank you for the invitation. Perhaps the only one who would invite the private me is Kanon... How should I repay your kindness?
My, running into you here is quite a coincidence.
You really are quite interesting. Fufu... Sorry, I laughed.
One must not be so ill-mannered...
Indeed... if the goal is merely to stand on a broad stage, then perhaps one needn't be constrained by mutual appearances...
